DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure PML Gene Retinoic Acid Receptor Alpha Assessment Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number for a procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting that tests a gene plays a role in tumor suppression and is involved in the regulation of p53 in response to oncogenic signal transduction and retinoic acid receptor alpha (encoded by the human RARA gene and involved in the regulation of both retinoic acid-dependent transcription and the cell cycle).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure PML Gene Retinoic Acid Receptor Alpha Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the final result of a procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting that tests a gene plays a role in tumor suppression and is involved in the regulation of p53 in response to oncogenic signal transduction and retinoic acid receptor alpha (encoded by the human RARA gene and involved in the regulation of both retinoic acid-dependent transcription and the cell cycle).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: PML Gene Retinoic Acid Receptor Alpha Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: This gene plays a role in tumor suppression and is involved in the regulation of p53 in response to oncogenic signal transduction.:Retinoic acid receptor alpha (462 aa, ~51 kDa) is encoded by the human RARA gene. This protein is involved in the regulation of both retinoic acid-dependent transcription and the cell cycle.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a role in tumor suppression and is involved in the regulation of p53 in response to oncogenic signal transduction.
Retinoic acid receptor alpha (462 aa, ~51 kDa) is encoded by the human RARA gene. This protein is involved in the regulation of both retinoic acid-dependent transcription and the cell cycle.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 4/22/16 tt, EVS definition provided for term.
